title: Passive Voice: Simple Tenses
description: Слушайте предложения в пассивном залоге простых времён.

tasks.audioText: The museum is one of the oldest in the city. It was built in eighteen ninety-five by a famous Italian architect.
tasks.transcript: It was built in eighteen ninety-five by a famous Italian architect.

options.text: A well-known Italian architect constructed the museum in 1895.
The museum was destroyed in 1895.
An Italian architect is building the museum now.
The museum will be built next year.

tasks.explanation: 'Was built' is Past Simple Passive — the museum was constructed in 1895 by the architect.

tasks.audioText: Security at this airport is extremely strict. Every piece of luggage is checked by trained officers before boarding.
tasks.transcript: Every piece of luggage is checked by trained officers before boarding.

options.text: Trained officers inspect all bags before passengers board the plane.
Passengers check their own luggage.
Luggage was checked yesterday only.
Nobody checks the luggage at this airport.

tasks.explanation: 'Is checked' is Present Simple Passive — a routine procedure where officers inspect every bag.

tasks.audioText: The government announced a new education reform. Thousands of new textbooks will be distributed to schools across the country.
tasks.transcript: Thousands of new textbooks will be distributed to schools across the country.

options.text: Schools distributed textbooks to the government.
New textbooks will be sent to schools nationwide in the future.
Textbooks were distributed last year.
No textbooks will be available for schools.

tasks.explanation: 'Will be distributed' is Future Simple Passive — the textbooks will be delivered to schools as a future action.

tasks.audioText: The new shopping centre opened last month. The grand opening ceremony was attended by over five thousand people.
tasks.transcript: The grand opening ceremony was attended by over five thousand people.

options.text: More than five thousand people came to the opening event.
Five thousand people avoided the ceremony.
The ceremony is happening right now.
Nobody attended the opening ceremony.

tasks.explanation: 'Was attended by' is Past Simple Passive — the focus is on the ceremony, with five thousand attendees.

tasks.audioText: Our company takes data protection very seriously. All sensitive information is encrypted before it leaves the server.
tasks.transcript: All sensitive information is encrypted before it leaves the server.

options.text: Sensitive data gets coded for protection before being transmitted from the server.
The server sends unencrypted data.
Information was encrypted only last month.
Encryption happens after the data leaves the server.

tasks.explanation: 'Is encrypted' is Present Simple Passive — a standard ongoing process for all sensitive data.

tasks.audioText: The charity event was a huge success. Over three hundred thousand dollars was raised for children's hospitals.
tasks.transcript: Over three hundred thousand dollars was raised for children's hospitals.

options.text: The event collected more than three hundred thousand dollars to support children's hospitals.
Three hundred thousand dollars was spent at the event.
No money was raised at the event.
The hospitals donated money to the charity.

tasks.explanation: 'Was raised' is Past Simple Passive — the focus is on the amount collected, not who donated.

tasks.audioText: The city council has big plans for the old harbour. A brand new park will be created in the waterfront area by next summer.
tasks.transcript: A brand new park will be created in the waterfront area by next summer.

options.text: The park was created last summer.
A new park is planned to be built near the water before next summer.
The waterfront area will be destroyed.
The council cancelled the park project.

tasks.explanation: 'Will be created' is Future Simple Passive — a planned future development in the waterfront area.

tasks.audioText: The painting is incredibly valuable. It was stolen from the national gallery in nineteen sixty-seven and recovered twenty years later.
tasks.transcript: It was stolen from the national gallery in nineteen sixty-seven and recovered twenty years later.

options.text: Someone took the painting from the gallery in 1967 and it was found again in 1987.
The painting is being stolen right now.
The painting was never recovered.
The gallery stole the painting from someone.

tasks.explanation: 'Was stolen' and 'recovered' are both Past Simple Passive — two past events in the painting's history.

tasks.audioText: The local newspaper covers community events regularly. Every new business opening is reported in the weekend edition.
tasks.transcript: Every new business opening is reported in the weekend edition.

options.text: The newspaper regularly features new business openings in its weekend issue.
New businesses report news to the newspaper.
The newspaper stopped covering business openings.
Business openings were reported only last weekend.

tasks.explanation: 'Is reported' is Present Simple Passive — a regular, habitual action by the newspaper.

tasks.audioText: The documentary revealed shocking facts. Millions of tonnes of plastic waste are dumped into the ocean every single year.
tasks.transcript: Millions of tonnes of plastic waste are dumped into the ocean every single year.

options.text: Vast amounts of plastic are thrown into the sea on an annual basis.
The ocean dumps plastic onto the land.
Plastic waste was dumped into the ocean only once.
No plastic ever enters the ocean.

tasks.explanation: 'Are dumped' is Present Simple Passive — a repeated, ongoing environmental problem.

tasks.audioText: The company is planning major changes. All employees will be informed about the restructuring by the end of this week.
tasks.transcript: All employees will be informed about the restructuring by the end of this week.

options.text: Employees were already informed last week.
Every employee will receive information about the changes before the week ends.
Only managers will be told about the restructuring.
The restructuring has been cancelled.

tasks.explanation: 'Will be informed' is Future Simple Passive — a planned notification for all staff before a deadline.

tasks.audioText: The ancient temple has an incredible history. It was discovered by archaeologists during a routine excavation in nineteen twelve.
tasks.transcript: It was discovered by archaeologists during a routine excavation in nineteen twelve.

options.text: Archaeologists found the temple while digging in 1912.
The temple discovered the archaeologists.
The temple is being excavated right now.
Nobody has ever found the temple.

tasks.explanation: 'Was discovered' is Past Simple Passive — the temple was found as a result of archaeological work in 1912.

tasks.audioText: Food safety regulations in this country are very strict. Every restaurant is inspected at least twice a year by health officials.
tasks.transcript: Every restaurant is inspected at least twice a year by health officials.

options.text: Restaurants inspect health officials twice yearly.
Health officials check each restaurant a minimum of two times annually.
Restaurants are never inspected in this country.
Inspections were stopped five years ago.

tasks.explanation: 'Is inspected' is Present Simple Passive — a routine regulatory process carried out regularly.

tasks.audioText: The old railway bridge needed urgent repair. It was closed to traffic last Tuesday and was repaired within four days.
tasks.transcript: It was closed to traffic last Tuesday and was repaired within four days.

options.text: The bridge shut down on Tuesday and the repairs took four days to complete.
The bridge is open and has never needed repairs.
Traffic closed the bridge permanently.
The bridge will be closed next Tuesday.

tasks.explanation: 'Was closed' and 'was repaired' are both Past Simple Passive — two sequential past events describing the bridge maintenance.

tasks.audioText: The technology conference attracts global attention each year. This year's keynote speech will be delivered by the CEO of a major tech company.
tasks.transcript: This year's keynote speech will be delivered by the CEO of a major tech company.

options.text: The CEO of a big tech firm will give the main presentation at this year's conference.
The keynote was delivered last year by the CEO.
There will be no keynote speech this year.
The audience will deliver the speech to the CEO.

tasks.explanation: 'Will be delivered' is Future Simple Passive — the keynote speech is scheduled to be given by the CEO.
